lower.cpp

00001 #include <ctype.h>
00002 #include <string>
00003 #include "lower.h"
00004 #include "upper.h"
00005 
00006 using namespace std;
00007 
00008 const string lower( const string& mix )
00009 {
00010    int n=mix.size();
00011    string low(mix);
00012    string::iterator p = low.begin();
00013    for( int i=0; i<n; i++ )
00014    {
00015       *p = tolower( *p );
00016       ++p;
00017    }
00018    return low;
00019 }
00020 //  For some reason, when the following routine
00021 // is defined in an independent file, say upper.cpp,
00022 // it doesn't get into the library.
00023 const string upper( const string& mix )
00024 {
00025    int n=mix.size();
00026    string up(mix);
00027    string::iterator p = up.begin();
00028    for( int i=0; i<n; i++ )
00029    {
00030       *p = toupper( *p );
00031       ++p;
00032    }
00033    return up;
00034 }
